intro: Agathophyllum ravensara, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs that help reduce water loss, a feature common in drought-tolerant species. Agathophyllum ravensara is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
